logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: Changes in reading habits

lexicalItems.sourceContext: What are the implications of the way we read today?

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The conclusion that can be drawn from something although it is not explicitly stated; a likely consequence of something

phase3Production.content: The new policy has serious implications for the economy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Older kids don’t read at all, but hunch over video games.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Còng lưng/khom người' (hunch over) trên trò chơi điện tử

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To bend your body forward and down so that your back is rounded

phase3Production.content: He would hunch over his computer for hours without taking a break.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Parents and other passengers read on tablets or skim a flotilla of email and news feeds.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To read through a large number of emails quickly to get the main ideas

phase3Production.content: Every morning, I have to skim a flotilla of email before I can start my real work.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Unbeknown to most of us, an invisible, game-changing transformation links everyone in this picture: the neuronal circuit that underlies the brain’s ability to read is subtly, rapidly changing...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A population of neurons interconnected by synapses to carry out a specific function when activated

phase3Production.content: Learning a new skill creates a new neuronal circuit in the brain.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the neuronal circuit that underlies the brain’s ability to read is subtly, rapidly changing...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Là nền tảng cho' (underlies) 'khả năng' (ability) 'của não bộ' (the brain's)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be the fundamental cause or basis of the brain's capacity for something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm nền tảng cho khả năng của não bộ

phase3Production.content: Complex chemical reactions underlie the brain's ability to form memories.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is subtly, rapidly changing...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In a way that is so delicate or precise as to be difficult to analyse or describe
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một cách tinh vi, khó nhận thấy

phase3Production.content: The meaning of the poem changed subtly with each reading.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: As work in neurosciences indicates, the acquisition of literacy necessitated a new circuit in our species’ brain more than 6,000 years ago.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'tiếp thu' (acquisition) 'khả năng biết chữ' (of literacy)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of learning to read and write
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Việc tiếp thu khả năng biết chữ

phase3Production.content: The acquisition of literacy is a fundamental step in a child's education.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the acquisition of literacy necessitated a new circuit in our species’ brain...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đã đòi hỏi/khiến cho cần thiết' (necessitated) 'một mạch mới' (a new circuit)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make a new circuit necessary

phase3Production.content: The growing population necessitated the construction of new housing.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to the present, highly elaborated reading brain.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bộ não 'đọc' (reading) 'phát triển cao/phức tạp' (highly elaborated)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A brain that has developed complex and detailed structures and processes for reading
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bộ não đọc được phát triển cao

phase3Production.content: Years of study resulted in a highly elaborated understanding of the subject.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...development of some of our most important intellectual and affective processes...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Mental functions relating to thinking and reasoning (intellectual) and to emotions and feelings (affective)
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các quá trình trí tuệ và cảm xúc

phase3Production.content: Psychology studies both the intellectual and affective processes that guide human behavior.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...internalized knowledge, analogical reasoning, and inference...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Knowledge that has been absorbed and made a part of one's own thinking and beliefs
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Kiến thức được nội tâm hóa

phase3Production.content: Through years of practice, the musician's skill became internalized knowledge.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...internalized knowledge, analogical reasoning, and inference...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A kind of thinking that involves comparing one thing with another to help explain or understand it

phase3Production.content: Using analogical reasoning, he compared the flow of electricity to the flow of water in a pipe.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...perspective-taking and empathy; critical analysis and the generation of insight.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Khả năng nhìn nhận quan điểm của người khác' (perspective-taking) 'và' (and) 'sự đồng cảm' (empathy)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The ability to understand things from another person's point of view and the ability to understand and share the feelings of another
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Việc nhìn nhận quan điểm và sự đồng cảm

phase3Production.content: Reading fiction is known to improve perspective-taking and empathy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...critical analysis and the generation of insight.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'tạo ra' (generation) 'sự thấu hiểu/sáng suốt' (of insight)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The creation of a clear, deep, and sometimes sudden understanding of a complicated problem or situation
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự tạo ra cái nhìn sâu sắc

phase3Production.content: Deep reflection is often necessary for the generation of true insight.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This is not a simple, binary issue of print versus digital reading...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'vấn đề' (issue) 'nhị phân/chỉ có hai mặt' (binary)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A problem or question that has only two possible options or sides

phase3Production.content: Climate change is not a binary issue of 'believe' or 'don't believe'; it's a complex scientific reality.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In this hinge moment between print and digital cultures, society needs to confront what is diminishing...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A critical point in time on which subsequent developments depend

phase3Production.content: The invention of the printing press was a hinge moment in human history.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: diminishing in the expert reading circuit
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...society needs to confront what is diminishing in the expert reading circuit...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những gì đang 'suy giảm' (diminishing) 'trong mạch đọc chuyên sâu' (in the expert reading circuit)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Becoming less or weaker in the neural pathways used for deep, skilled reading
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Suy giảm trong mạch đọc chuyên sâu

phase3Production.content: Researchers are concerned about the skills that are diminishing in the digital age.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: We know from research that the reading circuit is not given to human beings through a genetic blueprint like vision or language...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A plan or set of instructions for how something will develop, contained in the genes

phase3Production.content: DNA contains the genetic blueprint for every living organism.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: If the dominant medium advantages processes that are fast, multi-task oriented and well-suited for large volumes of information...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The main or most influential means of communication or expression

phase3Production.content: In the 20th century, television became the dominant medium for news and entertainment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...processes that are fast, multi-task oriented...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Designed for or focused on performing more than one task at the same time

phase3Production.content: Modern work environments are often fast-paced and multi-task oriented.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the result is that less attention and time will be allocated to slower, time-demanding deep reading processes.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be distributed or assigned for a particular purpose

phase3Production.content: More resources should be allocated to education and healthcare.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...slower, time-demanding deep reading processes.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Needing a lot of time to do

phase3Production.content: Learning a new language is a rewarding but time-demanding process.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Increasing reports from educators and from researchers in psychology and the humanities bear this out.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To confirm or support that something is true

phase3Production.content: The latest sales figures bear out the company's optimistic forecast.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...how many college students actively avoid the classic literature of the 19th and 20th centuries...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Literature that is judged over a period of time to be of the highest quality and outstanding of its kind

phase3Production.content: Shakespeare's plays are a cornerstone of classic literature in English.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in favour of something simpler as they no longer have the patience to read longer, denser, more difficult texts.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In preference for; choosing something instead of another

phase3Production.content: He abandoned his law career in favour of becoming a painter.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the patience to read longer, denser, more difficult texts.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'văn bản' (texts) 'dày đặc/cô đọng' (denser) 'và khó hơn' (more difficult)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Written materials that are more complex, with more information packed into them, and harder to understand
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các văn bản cô đọng, khó hơn

phase3Production.content: Academic journals often contain denser, more difficult texts than popular magazines.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: We should be less concerned with students’ ‘cognitive impatience’, however, than by what may underlie it...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'thiếu kiên nhẫn' (impatience) 'về mặt nhận thức' (cognitive)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A reluctance or inability to spend time on tasks that require sustained mental effort
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự thiếu kiên nhẫn về mặt nhận thức

phase3Production.content: The constant stream of notifications on our phones can foster cognitive impatience.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the potential inability of large numbers of students to read with a level of critical analysis sufficient to comprehend the complexity of thought and argument...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To understand the intricate and complicated nature of something

phase3Production.content: It takes time to fully comprehend the complexity of the legal system.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...found in more demanding texts.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Written materials that require a lot of skill, effort, and concentration to understand
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các văn bản đòi hỏi cao

phase3Production.content: Philosophy often involves reading and analysing very demanding texts.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a variety of troubling downstream effects on reading comprehension in older high school and college students.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'ảnh hưởng' (effects) 'về sau/hệ quả' (downstream) 'đáng lo ngại' (troubling)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Consequences or effects that happen later as a result of something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các hiệu ứng xuôi dòng (hệ quả)

phase3Production.content: The policy had a number of unintended downstream effects on the economy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a short story whose plot had universal student appeal...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sức hấp dẫn' (appeal) 'phổ quát' (universal) 'đối với sinh viên' (student)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The quality of being attractive or interesting to all or most students
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sức hấp dẫn phổ quát đối với sinh viên

phase3Production.content: The Harry Potter books have a universal appeal that transcends age and culture.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Results indicated that students who read on print were superior in their comprehension to screen-reading peers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Vượt trội hơn' (superior) 'về' (in) 'khả năng đọc hiểu' (their comprehension)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Better in terms of their ability to understand something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vượt trội về khả năng hiểu

phase3Production.content: The expert was clearly superior in her comprehension of the complex topic.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...particularly in their ability to sequence detail and reconstruct the plot in chronological order.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To build up a picture or account of the main events of a story in the order they happened

phase3Production.content: After watching the film, they tried to reconstruct the plot from memory.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...reconstruct the plot in chronological order.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The arrangement of things following one after another in time

phase3Production.content: Please arrange the historical events in chronological order.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Many readers now use a pattern when reading in which they sample the first line and then word-spot through the rest of the text.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The action of looking for and finding particular words in a text, rather than reading it completely

phase3Production.content: Word-spotting is a useful skill for finding specific information quickly, but it is not deep reading.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In other words, we don’t have time to grasp complexity, to understand another’s feelings, to perceive beauty...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To fully understand the complicated nature of something

phase3Production.content: It took him a while to grasp the full complexity of the situation.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to perceive beauty, and to create thoughts of the reader’s own.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To become aware of or recognize beauty through the senses

phase3Production.content: Art helps us to perceive beauty in the world around us.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The possibility that critical analysis, empathy and other deep reading processes could become the unintended ‘collateral damage’ of our digital culture...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Thiệt hại ngoài dự kiến/thiệt hại phụ' (collateral damage)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Injury inflicted on something other than an intended target; unintended negative consequences

phase3Production.content: The closure of the factory had the collateral damage of bankrupting many small local businesses.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The subtle atrophy of critical analysis and empathy affects us all equally.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A gradual and hard-to-detect decline or wasting away of a faculty or skill

phase3Production.content: Without regular practice, you can experience a subtle atrophy of your language skills.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It affects our ability to navigate a constant bombardment of information.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'sự bắn phá' (bombardment) 'thông tin' (of information) 'liên tục' (constant)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A continuous attack or overwhelming stream of information
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự oanh tạc thông tin liên tục

phase3Production.content: In today's world, we face a constant bombardment of information from social media.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It incentivizes a retreat to the most familiar stores of unchecked information...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Khuyến khích' (incentivizes) 'việc rút lui về' (a retreat to)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To provide a motive or encouragement to withdraw to something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khuyến khích việc rút lui về

phase3Production.content: The complexity of the problem incentivizes a retreat to simpler, but incorrect, solutions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the most familiar stores of unchecked information...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Information that has not been examined to see if it is true or correct
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thông tin chưa được kiểm chứng

phase3Production.content: The spread of unchecked information on the internet is a serious problem.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...leaving us susceptible to false information and irrational ideas.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Dễ bị ảnh hưởng bởi' (susceptible to) 'thông tin sai lệch' (false information)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Likely or liable to be influenced or harmed by untrue information
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dễ bị ảnh hưởng bởi thông tin sai lệch

phase3Production.content: People who get their news only from social media are more susceptible to false information.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...leaving us susceptible to false information and irrational ideas.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Ideas that are not logical or reasonable

phase3Production.content: Panic can lead people to believe in irrational ideas.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There’s an old rule in neuroscience that does not alter with age: use it or lose it.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Không thay đổi' (does not alter) 'theo tuổi tác' (with age)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Does not change as one gets older
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không thay đổi theo tuổi tác

phase3Production.content: Unlike physical strength, the capacity for wisdom does not alter with age.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: We possess both the science and the technology to identify and redress the changes in how we read...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To remedy or set right the alterations that have occurred

phase3Production.content: The government has promised to redress the changes that negatively impacted the community.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...before they become entrenched.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trước khi chúng 'trở nên cố hữu/ăn sâu' (become entrenched)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be established so firmly that change is very difficult or unlikely

phase3Production.content: It is difficult to change bad habits once they become entrenched.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...alongside the extraordinary new capacities that the digital world has brought us...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Very unusual or remarkable new abilities or powers
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những năng lực mới phi thường

phase3Production.content: The internet has given us extraordinary new capacities for communication and learning.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...there is as much reason for excitement as caution.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có nhiều 'lý do' (reason) 'để phấn khích' (for excitement) 'cũng như' (as) 'để thận trọng' (caution)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: There are equal grounds for feeling both excited and careful
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lý do để phấn khích cũng như thận trọng

relatedCollocates.form: a mix of excitement and caution

phase3Production.content: With any powerful new technology, there is as much reason for excitement as caution.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: That circuit evolved from a very simple mechanism for decoding basic information, like the number of goats in one’s herd...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Giải mã thông tin cơ bản

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To convert simple coded messages into intelligible language or information
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giải mã thông tin cơ bản

phase3Production.content: The earliest forms of writing were used for decoding basic information for trade and accounting.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...we ignore what we disrupt or diminish while innovating.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Làm suy giảm trong khi đổi mới

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make something less or weaker during the process of introducing new methods or ideas
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm suy giảm trong khi đổi mới

phase3Production.content: We must be careful not to diminish important traditions while innovating for the future.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Increasing reports from educators and from researchers in psychology and the humanities bear this out.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Tâm lý học và khoa học nhân văn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The academic disciplines of the scientific study of the human mind and its functions, and human culture, such as literature, history, and philosophy
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tâm lý học và khoa học nhân văn

phase3Production.content: She has a degree in psychology and the humanities, focusing on the history of ideas.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to read with a level of critical analysis sufficient to comprehend the complexity of thought...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mức độ phân tích phản biện

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The degree of detailed, objective analysis and evaluation of an issue in order to form a judgement
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mức độ phân tích phê phán

phase3Production.content: His essay demonstrated a high level of critical analysis.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...superior in their comprehension to screen-reading peers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những bạn đồng trang lứa đọc trên màn hình

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: People of the same age or status who read on digital screens
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các bạn đồng trang lứa đọc trên màn hình

phase3Production.content: The study compared the test scores of traditional readers with their screen-reading peers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that changes not only what we read, but also the purposes for which we read.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những mục đích mà chúng ta đọc

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The reasons why we engage in the activity of reading
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những mục đích mà chúng ta đọc

phase3Production.content: The purposes for which we read have expanded to include quick information gathering and social interaction.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The subtle atrophy of critical analysis and empathy affects us all equally.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ảnh hưởng đến tất cả chúng ta một cách như nhau

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have an effect on everyone in the same way or to the same extent
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ảnh hưởng đến tất cả chúng ta như nhau

phase3Production.content: Climate change is a global problem that affects us all, though not equally.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It is a very hopeful principle when applied to critical thought because it implies choice.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một nguyên tắc đầy hy vọng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behavior and offers optimism

phase3Production.content: The idea that people can change is a hopeful principle that underlies all therapy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...because it implies choice.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To suggest that there is an opportunity or power to choose between two or more possibilities

phase3Production.content: The phrase 'it's up to you' implies choice and personal responsibility.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: possess both the science and the technology
lexicalItems.sourceContext: We possess both the science and the technology to identify and redress the changes...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sở hữu cả khoa học và công nghệ

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /pəˈzes bəʊθ ðə ˈsaɪəns ənd ðə tekˈnɒlədʒi/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have both the systematic knowledge and the practical tools and techniques
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sở hữu cả khoa học và công nghệ

phase3Production.content: We now possess both the science and the technology to create sustainable energy sources.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: If we work to understand exactly what we will lose, alongside the extraordinary new capacities that the digital world has brought us...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: What we are in danger of no longer having

phase3Production.content: If we don't protect our environment, we will lose countless species.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...from the pre-reading toddler to the expert adult.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trẻ mới biết đi chưa biết đọc

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A young child who is just beginning to walk and has not yet learned to read
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trẻ mới biết đi chưa biết đọc

phase3Production.content: Picture books are essential for a pre-reading toddler's development.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a very simple mechanism for decoding basic information...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Giải mã thông tin cơ bản

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of converting simple coded messages or symbols into understandable information
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giải mã thông tin cơ bản

phase3Production.content: Learning the alphabet is the first step in decoding basic information from text.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Research surfacing in many parts of the world now cautions that...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Research that is appearing or becoming known

phase3Production.content: New research surfacing online suggests a different approach to the problem.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In this hinge moment between print and digital cultures...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các nền văn hóa kỹ thuật số

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The ideas, customs, and social behavior of societies that are heavily influenced by digital technology
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các nền văn hóa kỹ thuật số

phase3Production.content: Memes are an interesting aspect of modern digital cultures.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...from different writing systems to the characteristics of whatever medium is used.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Methods of visually representing verbal communication, based on a set of symbols and rules

phase3Production.content: Alphabetic and logographic are two different types of writing systems.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...well-suited for large volumes of information...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A great quantity or amount of information

phase3Production.content: The internet allows us to access large volumes of information instantly.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...how many college students actively avoid the classic literature...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make a conscious effort to stay away from something

phase3Production.content: He actively avoids any situation that involves public speaking.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to comprehend the complexity of thought and argument found in more demanding texts.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of thinking and the exchange of diverging or opposite views

phase3Production.content: The book is valued for the depth of its thought and argument.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...how high school students comprehend the same material in different mediums.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Various means of communication, such as print, digital screens, or audio

phase3Production.content: The artist works in different mediums, including painting and sculpture.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...involving word-spotting and browsing through the text.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To look through a text casually without reading it in detail

phase3Production.content: I was just browsing through the book in the library and decided to borrow it.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and to create thoughts of the reader’s own.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những suy nghĩ của riêng người đọc

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Original ideas and reflections formed by the reader, rather than just passively receiving information
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những suy nghĩ của riêng người đọc

phase3Production.content: A good book should stimulate thoughts of the reader's own.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...we all have begun to read on various mediums...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đọc trên nhiều phương tiện khác nhau

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To read using different platforms or formats, such as books, tablets, or phones
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đọc trên nhiều phương tiện khác nhau

phase3Production.content: In the modern age, we are accustomed to reading on various mediums.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a retreat to the most familiar stores of unchecked information...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những kho lưu trữ quen thuộc

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Sources or supplies of something that are well known

phase3Production.content: When stressed, people often return to the familiar stores of comfort food.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it implies choice.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To suggest that there is an opportunity or power to choose between two or more possibilities

phase3Production.content: The open-ended question implies choice in how you answer.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The story of the changing reading brain is hardly finished.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Far from being over; only just begun

phase3Production.content: We've only just started; the project is hardly finished.
